Cover and chill the dough in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.. Remove chilled dough from the refrigerator; roll into twenty 1-inch diameter balls.

name: Energy Balls without Peanut Butter
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pumpkin seeds'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pecans'}, {'quantity': '15', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pitted Medjool dates'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown rice syrup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mini chocolate chips'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sunflower seeds'}
steps: Burst oats into a coarse meal in the bowl of a food processor. Add pumpkin seeds, walnuts, and pecans; pulse 10 to 15 times, until chunks are desired size.. Toss dates into the food processor and mix for 30 seconds. Pour rice syrup in slowly, with the processor running, until combined and starting to ball up.. Transfer to a bowl and mix in chocolate chips, coconut, raisins, and sunflower seeds. Pull off dough in 25 gram sections and roll into balls. Place in a single layer on a cookie sheet; it's okay if they touch but make sure they are not stacked.. Refrigerate for 2 to 24 hours before serving.

name: Easy Peanut Butter Energy Balls
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crushed walnuts'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'semisweet chocolate chips'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey, or more as needed'}
steps: Combine oats, peanut butter, crushed walnuts, chocolate chips, and honey in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment; beat until well combined, adding more honey if the mixture is not holding together.. Form 24 balls with a cookie scoop and place on a cookie sheet. Refrigerate until firm, 30 to 60 minutes.

name: High-Protein Energy Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dark chocolate chips'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ground flax seeds'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chocolate-flavored protein powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsweetened shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chia seeds'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'coconut extract'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped coffee beans'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': "cocoa powder (such as Fry's®), or more as needed"}
steps: Mix oats, peanut butter, honey, dark chocolate chips, flax seeds, protein powder, coconut, chia seeds, and coconut extract together in a large bowl; fold in coffee beans. Form mixture into 1-inch balls.. Place cocoa powder in a small bowl. Roll each ball in the cocoa powder until coated.

name: Swedish Chocolate Balls (Chokladbollar)
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'quick-cooking rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '3 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coconut oil, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'strong brewed coffee'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsweetened grated coconut, or as needed'}
steps: Heat a pan over medium heat and add oats. Toss and shake until fragrant and lightly toasted, 5 to 7 minutes.. Combine sugar, cocoa powder, salt, cayenne, butter, coconut oil, vanilla extract, and coffee in a bowl. Add the oats and mix until thoroughly combined.. Portion dough into balls using a sorbet scoop. Roll balls in grated coconut and transfer to a parchment-lined baking pan. Let them firm up in the fridge for 15 to 20 minutes.

name: Daniel Fast Peanut Butter Balls
ingredients: {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown rice syrup'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coconut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'natural peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'regular or quick-cooking oats, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsweetened flaked coconut'}
steps: Combine brown rice syrup and coconut oil in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir until melted and boiling, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from the heat.. Add peanut butter and vanilla to the syrup mixture and stir until smooth. Stir in oats, raisins, and coconut until well combined. Refrigerate mixture until cool, at least 30 minutes.. Form cooled mixture into balls. Freeze balls until set, at least 1 hour.

name: Crunchy Chocolate Chip Peanut Butter Snack Bites

steps: Mix together oats, peanut butter, honey, peanuts, and chocolate chips in a medium bowl until blended. Refrigerate for 20 to 30 minutes.. Roll into twenty 1-inch balls, using about 2 tablespoons for each one.

name: Greek Yogurt Peanut Butter Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'natural peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'nonfat vanilla Greek yogurt'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flaxseed meal'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'cacao nibs'}

Scoop up about 1 tablespoon of mixture with a small cookie scoop or spoon and roll lightly into a ball with your hands. Place in an airtight container and refrigerate for about 1 hour before serving.

name: Oatmeal Almond Butter Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'semisweet chocolate chips'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chia seeds'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ground flax seeds'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely shredded unsweetened coconut'}

Shape into 1-inch balls. Place balls onto a parchment-lined baking sheet and freeze until firm, about 30 minutes.

name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Energy Balls

name: 9 Energy Bite Recipes That Are Easy and Flavorful
No Bake Energy Balls
ingredients: {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'wheat germ'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}

name: Sweet Potato Energy Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cooked and mashed sweet potato'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond meal'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'hemp seeds'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'honey, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sea salt'}
steps: Place mashed sweet potato, oats, almond meal, hemp seeds, almond butter, honey, cinnamon, vanilla, and sea salt into a bowl and stir until all ingredients are well combined.. Refrigerate the mixture for 15 minutes. Roll chilled mixture into about 20 1-inch balls. Place energy balls back into the refrigerator for 15 minutes until set and cold. Store in a covered container in the refrigerator for 3 to 5 days.

name: Protein Balls with Vanilla Protein Powder

steps: Mix oats, almond butter, quinoa, chia seeds, flax seeds, protein powder, cocoa nibs, and honey together in a bowl by hand.. Roll into bite-sized balls and place on parchment paper.. Refrigerate for at least 20 minutes before serving.

name: Peanut Butter Energy Balls
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'toasted wheat germ'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'nonfat dry milk powder'}
steps: Combine wheat germ, peanut butter, honey, and milk powder in a bowl; shape into 20 bite-sized balls. Arrange balls on a plate.. Place in the freezer until solid, at least 1 hour.

name: 5-Ingredient Keto and Vegan Chocolate Almond Balls
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond butter'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegan chocolate chips'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped almonds'}
steps: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.. Combine almond flour, almond butter, and vanilla extract in a bowl; mix until well combined and a soft dough is formed. Shape dough into 1/2-inch balls and place on the prepared baking sheet. Freeze until set, about 20 minutes.. Melt chocolate chips in a microwave-safe glass or ceramic bowl in 15-second intervals, stirring after each interval, 1 to 3 minutes. Dip cookie balls in the melted chocolate and place on the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle with chopped almonds and let sit until chocolate is set, about 10 minutes.

name: Peanut Butter Protein Balls
ingredients: {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'oats'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chocolate chips, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'scoops', 'name': 'protein powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}
steps: Combine milk, peanut butter, oats, chocolate chips, protein powder, and cinnamon in a medium mixing bowl and mix.. Scoop and shape into balls using a spoon. Place into a freezer bag and store in the freezer.

name: Sesame Date Rolls
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'chopped dried dates'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'hot water as needed'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'toasted sesame seeds, divided'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped walnuts'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'whole raw almonds'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsweetened shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'coconut oil'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Place dates in a small bowl and completely cover with hot water. Allow to soak until softened, 10 to 15 minutes. Drain, and reserve soaking liquid.. Combine soaked dates, 2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds, walnuts, almonds, coconut, coconut oil, cardamom, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt in the bowl of a large food processor. Pulse several times until mixture comes together to form a soft "dough," scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. If mixture is too dry, add reserved soaking liquid, 1 tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency is reached.. Turn out dough on a piece of parchment paper. Roll into a 10-inch long by 1 1/2-inch wide log using lightly greased hands. Sprinkle remaining toasted sesame seeds evenly over log on all sides, pressing them in gently. Wrap log in parchment paper, and refrigerate until firm, at least 1 to 2 hours.. Remove log from fridge, and cut into about sixteen 1/2-inch thick rounds. Serve immediately or store in the refrigerator until ready to use.

name: Gluten-Free Fried Oatmeal Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'quick-cooking oats'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cane sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'Himalayan pink salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'gluten-free all purpose baking flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil, or as needed'}
steps: Bring water to a boil in a pot; reduce heat to low. Add almond milk and stir in oats. Add sugar, stirring vigorously. Stir in salt. Continue to simmer until oats have reached your desired consistency, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool, 15 to 20 minutes.. Transfer oats to a lidded container, cover, and chill in a refrigerator, 30 minutes to 2 hours.. Whisk egg in a small bowl. Place gluten-free flour in a separate bowl.. Scoop chilled oatmeal into medium-size balls.. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.. Place oatmeal balls into egg wash until completely covered. Place in flour; cover entirely. Use a slotted spoon to remove floured oatmeal balls; shake off excess flour.. Place oatmeal balls into the hot oil and cook until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes on each side.

name: Zucchini Chocolate Oatmeal Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'gluten-free oats'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond butter'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coarsely shredded zucchini'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dairy-free mini chocolate chips'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'flaxseed meal'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}
steps: Mix oats, almond butter, zucchini, chocolate chips, honey, flaxseed meal, and ground cinnamon in a large bowl until combined.. Divide mixture into 18 bite-sized pieces and roll into balls. Arrange in a storage container and refrigerate until set, about 1 hour.

name: Vegan Keto Lemon Fat Bombs
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry unsweetened shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coconut oil, at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'powdered erythritol sweetener (such as Swerve®)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'sea salt'}
steps: Blend shredded coconut in a food processor until creamy, about 15 minutes. Add coconut oil, erythritol, lemon zest, and sea salt; blend until well combined. Fill mini muffin cups with mixture and chill in the fridge until set, about 30 minutes.

name: Carrot Cake Freezer Energy Balls
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely shredded carrots'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'quick-cooking steel-cut oats'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flax seed meal'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped walnuts'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped raisins'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground ginger'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.. Combine carrots, oats, flax meal, peanut butter, honey, walnuts, raisins, vanilla, cinnamon, ginger, and salt in a bowl. Beat with a hand mixer until well combined.. Roll mixture into 12 equal-sized balls and place on the baking sheet. Freeze until they hold their shape, at least 1 hour. Transfer to a freezer-safe container and store in the freezer.

name: Pumpkin-Almond-Date Balls
ingredients: {'quantity': '22', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Medjool dates, pitted'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped almonds, divided'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded unsweetened coconut'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pumpkin puree'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsweetened cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'pumpkin pie spice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Combine dates, 1/3 cup almonds, coconut, pumpkin puree, cocoa powder, vanilla extract, pumpkin pie spice, and salt in a food processor. Blend until well combined. Roll spoonfuls of mixture into balls between your palms; place on a parchment-paper-lined baking sheet.. Place remaining 1/3 cup almonds on a plate. Roll balls in the almonds until coated. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until set, at least 1 hour.

name: Peanut Butter Energy Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-natural peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'quick-cooking oats (such as British Class®)'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cocoa nibs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract (such as Cool Runnings®)'}
steps: Combine peanut butter, quick cooking oats, cocoa nubs, honey, and vanilla extract in a bowl. Use a tablespoon to scoop out small portions and roll into balls using your hands.

name: Whey Protein Energy Bars
ingredients: {'quantity': '15', 'unit': '', 'name': 'dates, pitted and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'oat flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'whey protein powder'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsweetened cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped pecans, divided'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded coconut, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'water, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'semisweet chocolate chips'}
steps: Place dates in a bowl and add boiling water to cover. Let soak for 10 minutes. Strain dates and discard the water.. Blend oat flour, protein powder, and cocoa powder in a food processor until well combined. Add dates, 1/2 cup pecans, 1/2 cup coconut, vanilla, and salt. Pulse to combine, adding water as needed, to get a soft dough consistency.. Transfer dough to a bowl. Add remaining pecans, remaining coconut, and chocolate chips; mix well.. Scrape dough onto a piece of parchment paper and place another piece of parchment paper on top. Toll bars out to about 1/2-inch thick. Refrigerate until firm, 2 to 3 hours.. Slice into 12 bars and serve.

name: Chocolate-Cranberry Energy Bars
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raw almonds'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted dates'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried cranberries'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'unsweetened cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.. Pulse almonds and walnuts together in the bowl of a food processor until chopped. Add dates and cranberries, a little at a time, and continue to chop. Add coconut, cocoa, and vanilla extract. Process to desired consistency.. Roll dough into a 2-inch wide log and cut into ten 3/4-inch thick pucks. Place on the prepared baking sheet.. Bake in the preheated oven until set, about 10 minutes.

name: Carrot Cake No-Bake Energy Bars
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'whole raw almonds'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pitted and chopped Medjool dates'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded carrots'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsweetened shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried pineapple pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'scoop', 'name': 'vanilla protein powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'almond butter'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'coconut extract'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'almond extract'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'pumpkin pie spice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}
steps: Line a 9-inch square dish with parchment paper.. Combine almonds, dates, carrots, coconut, pineapple pieces, protein powder, almond butter, coconut extract, almond extract, pumpkin pie spice, and cinnamon in a food processor fitted with the S blade. Attach the lid and pulse, stopping and scraping down the sides as needed, until everything is well combined and a crumbly, yet easily moldable, soft dough forms.. Transfer dough to the prepared dish and press it down and smooth it out evenly.. Chill in the refrigerator or freezer for 1 to 2 hours. Cut into 12 bars and either serve immediately or wrap individually to serve later.

name: No-Bake Cranberry-Pecan Energy Balls
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'old-fashioned rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond flour'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dark chocolate chips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground flax seed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground chia seeds'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried cranberries'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped pecans'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'creamy peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}
steps: Mix oats, almond flour, chocolate chips, flax seed, and chia seeds together in a large bowl. Add cranberries, pecans, peanut butter, honey, and vanilla and mix with your hands (you may want to wear gloves).. Roll dough into twenty four 1 1/2-inch balls and place in resealable bags. Store in the refrigerator for up to 4 to 5 days, or freeze until ready to use.

name: T's Peanut Butter Balls
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(18 ounce) jar', 'name': 'crunchy peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coconut oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'agave nectar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Celtic sea salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flax seed meal'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'hempseed'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bags', 'name': 'dark chocolate chips (such as Ghirardelli®)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pecan pieces'}
steps: Beat peanut butter in a bowl of a stand mixer on low speed until creamy. Add coconut oil, agave nectar, sea salt, flax seed, hempseed, rolled oats, dark chocolate chips, and pecan pieces respectively, beating dough well after each addition.. Scoop dough into smalls balls onto a plate. Chill in the refrigerator until set, at least 30 minutes.

name: Black Garlic Chocolate Protein Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roasted honey peanut butter (such as Skippy®)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chocolate protein powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'solo black garlic bulbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'Neufchatel cheese, softened'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'sanding sugar, or as needed'}
steps: Combine peanut butter, protein powder, black garlic, and Neufchatel cheese in a mini food processor. Pulse until well combined.. Roll mixture into sixteen 1-inch balls. Roll in sanding sugar. Serve immediately or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

name: Carrot Cake Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '15', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pitted Deglet Noor dates'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'dried apricots'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped carrot'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped walnuts'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsweetened coconut flakes'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'toasted almond butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'flax seed meal'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground ginger'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Combine dates and apricots in a small measuring cup or bowl. Add enough hot water to cover and allow fruit to soak for 15 minutes to soften.. Drain dates and apricots and add to the bowl of a food processor. Add carrots, walnuts, coconut flakes, almond butter, flax meal, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, vanilla extract, and salt. Pulse, scraping down the sides frequently, until mixture comes together to form a mostly smooth, sticky dough, 5 to 7 minutes.. Scoop out tablespoon-sized balls of dough using a lightly greased tablespoon measure. Roll into balls with lightly greased hands.. Place bites into an airtight container and freeze until set, at least 1 hour. Keep stored in the freezer.

name: Vegan Energy Balls
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ground almonds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'almond butter'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'agave syrup'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'hemp protein powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'shredded coconut'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': '1 tablespoon raw coconut sap'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'pumpkin seeds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'flax seeds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'sunflower seeds'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'dried apple slices, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped walnuts'}
steps: Combine ground almonds and cinnamon in a small bowl; set aside.. Mix almond butter, agave syrup, and protein powder together in a bowl. Add shredded coconut, coconut sap, and nutmeg.. Combine pumpkin, flax, and sesame seeds in the bowl of a food processor; pulse until blended. Add to almond butter mixture along with sunflower seeds.. Mince dried apple in the food processor. Add to almond butter mixture along with walnuts. Form into 1-inch balls and roll in the almond-cinnamon mixture to coat.. Place in the freezer to firm up and store.

name: One-Bite Snack Balls (No-Bake)
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rolled oats'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated carrots'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped dates'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}
steps: Combine oats and carrots in the bowl of a food processor; pulse until blended. Add dates, brown sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla; blend again.. Transfer mixture to a bowl and stir in raisins and honey. Roll into 8 balls.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Protein Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'soy protein powder (such as MLO®)'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'oat flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain Greek yogurt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, softened'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'milk, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chocolate chips'}
steps: Combine all-purpose flour, soy protein powder, and oat flour together in a bowl.. Beat white sugar, brown sugar, yogurt, and butter together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Add vanilla extract. Stir in flour mixture. Mix in milk, 1 tablespoon at a time, until batter is thick and smooth. Fold in chocolate chips.. Roll batter into 1-inch balls with your hands. Arrange on a baking sheet. Transfer to the freezer and chill until firm, about 1 hour, or in the refrigerator, 2 to 3 hours.
